decks.notes: The main idea behind this deck is to utilize The Mimeoplasm as the commander to combo off and win the game. The deck includes a variety of spells and creatures that focus on reanimation, graveyard recursion, and card advantage. It also features powerful threats and control elements to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to set up a powerful combination of cards that either generate infinite value or outright win the game. By carefully managing resources and making strategic plays, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with its synergistic interactions. Additionally, the mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent quickly. With Anafenza, the Foremost as the commander, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The deck includes a variety of mana fixing lands, mana dorks, and powerful creatures to ramp up quickly and play threats efficiently. In addition, the deck features removal spells, disruptive creatures, and powerful equipment to deal with opposing threats and protect its own creatures. By combining aggression with disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through efficient play and smart decision-making.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with the help of mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Birds of Paradise, as well as spells like Farseek and Nature's Lore. This allows for early plays and quick access to Prossh, Skyraider of Kher, the commander of the deck. The deck also includes combo pieces such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Zealous Conscripts to create infinite combos with Prossh's token generation. Additionally, there are various utility creatures and removal spells to control the board and protect the combo. The deck aims to win through a combination of combat damage and combo finishes, utilizing the commander's abilities to its full potential.

The deck relies on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and push through damage quickly. Sygg, River Cutthroat serves as the commander, providing card advantage and an evasive attacker. The deck includes a mix of efficient Merfolk creatures alongside versatile spells like Counterspell, Cryptic Command, and Force of Will to counter opposing plays and protect its board. Additionally, hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful finishers like True-Name Nemesis and Sword of Feast and Famine to close out games. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a win.

The key idea behind this deck is to control the game through counter spells, removal, and card draw, while utilizing Grand Arbiter Augustin IV's ability to tax opponents' spells. By disrupting your opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, removing threats with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Detention Sphere, and drawing cards with Sphinx's Revelation and Deep Analysis, you can outvalue and outmaneuver your opponent. The deck aims to establish board control with sweepers like Day of Judgment and Terminus, while also deploying threats like Consecrated Sphinx and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game. With a strong mana base and a variety of answers, this deck seeks to control the pace of the game and grind out a win.

The main goal of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource to consistently bring back powerful creatures from the dead and create powerful combos. This is achieved through cards like Karador, Ghost Chieftain, which allows you to cast creatures from the graveyard, as well as cards like Reanimate, Victimize, and Recurring Nightmare to bring creatures back to the battlefield. The deck also includes a variety of creatures with powerful abilities to further enhance your board state, such as Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Primeval Titan. With efficient mana ramp, card selection, and graveyard recursion, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats and outvalue them in the long game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and board wipes while using Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon as the commander to present a fast clock and close out the game with infect damage. The deck is built around a strong suite of removal spells like Go for the Throat, Toxic Deluge, and Murder to keep the opponent's board in check. Additionally, there are hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phyrexian Crusader and Plague Stinger to quickly end the game with infect damage. This control deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents by controlling the board and leveraging Skithiryx's infect ability to secure victory.

This deck is focused on aggressive gameplay, utilizing Zurgo Helmsmasher as the commander. The key strategy is to control the board with removal spells and land destruction while deploying efficient threats to chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon disrupt opponents' mana bases, while cards like Sword to Plowshares and Damnation deal with opposing creatures. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Elspeth, Knight-Errant and Ajani Vengeant to close out games. Overall, the goal of this deck is to apply constant pressure, disrupt opponents' strategies, and ultimately secure victory through efficient aggression and resource denial.
